review.summary: Simple and clean __init__.py module file that exports two action executor implementations. This file follows Python packaging conventions perfectly by providing a minimal interface to expose the DefaultActionExecutor and EnhancedActionExecutor classes. The file maintains the neo-commons pattern of using comprehensive __all__ lists for explicit public API control.

positive_observations.observation: Perfect adherence to neo-commons architectural pattern with comprehensive __all__ list for explicit public API control
Clean and minimal module interface that follows Python packaging best practices
Consistent naming convention with executor classes ending in "Executor"
Proper module docstring providing clear purpose description
No unnecessary complexity or code smell - exactly what an __init__.py should be

context.tests: No tests required for simple module export file
context.documentation: Module docstring provides adequate documentation for the file's purpose
context.configuration: No configuration required for this simple export module
